review: The system was simple to set up but it just didn't get enough channels.  I already had a Roku 2 player but my mom, who lives with my wife and I, thought it would nice to watch YouTube on the TV.  She was not all that impressed and chose to watch it on her IPad instead so I returned it.  I don't really have anything negative to say about the box it just didn't meet the needs of the person who was going to be using it; my mom.
author: Craig

review: I know a lot of folks who praise AppleTV and when my Panasonic streaming device crapped out...I thought I'd give it a try.  Yes, I should have looked over the product specs in more detail but there were two reasons I was forced to return it.  One, it doesn't support Amazon Prime.  Two, you have to use the TV in order to stream music.  I ended up getting a Roku and an Airport for the music.  Apple needs to get this figured out.
author: Ojosv

review: I have an old Sony Bravia LCD TV, and it doesn't have a wireless connection. Well, it didn't. As soon as I connected Apple TV to my TV, I was able to use Comcast remove app with my iPhone because my TV got connected to the wireless network through Apple TV. So right now, in addition the great benefits of Apple TV, I can also control my TV from my iPhone, which allows me to get rid of at least one remote controller... I recommend this to every Apple user...
author: Can Sarisozen

review: Let me start out by saying I am comparing this product to other products I personally own.  Apple TV is still the best streaming and mirroring combo device.  If you own an Apple product like the iPhone, iTouch, iPad, and Mac, you can seamlessly stream video and audio content to the Apple TV on iOS devices and mirror your screen on Macs.  This is probably the most powerful feature of the Apple TV and why I love it.The problem with the Apple TV 3rd generation is that it is currently not able to be jailbroken and has not been for some time, that is why I do not use the Apple TV to its full potential, however I do on the 2nd generation.  With 1080 over 720 on the 2nd generation, sometimes I wish the 3rd gen can be jailbroken then it will truly deserve a 5-star rating and can be crowned the best media streaming device, period.
author: Tam

review: We have one of these at church for our projector for our Pastor to use with his iPad.  I loved it so much, I now have one at home!
author: P. Arceneaux

review: The Apple TV works, but setting it up is a challenge. I'm no novice to technology and I followed the prompts carefully, but could not get the Apple TV to recognize my iPad even though both showed up on the same WiFi. I searched the Apple website and internet for troubleshooting tips (not very useful) and ended up just trying as many things as I could think of, including starting over, shutting down, etc. I can't explain why, but it suddenly worked. I then attempted to set it up on a different WiFi in a different location, with the same results (long period of trial and error, followed by sudden connection after starting over, shutting down, etc.). Next came a different TV on the same WiFi, with yes, the same results. This is a pretty cool product, but my advice if you plan on using it for anything important is to set it up well in advance and leave it connected. No telling how long it will take.
